change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 213/2011, effective July 1, 2012.

section.sectiontext: In this regulation, Act means the Insurance Act.

subsection.subsectiontext: For the purposes of section 28.6 (1) (d) of the Act, all classes of persons other than natural persons are prescribed.
For the purposes of section 28.6 (3), a person described by that provision must co-operate with the insurer in respect of the investigation of the loss, including, without limitation,

paragraph.paragraphtext: by submitting to an examination under oath, if requested by the insurer, and
by producing for examination at a reasonable time and place designated by the insurer, documents specified by the insurer that relate to the loss.

section.sectiontext: Section 14 of the Insurance Amendment Act, 2009, insofar as it enacts section 28.6 [recovery by innocent persons] of the Act, does not apply to a contract in respect of loss or damage covered by the contract if the loss or damage occurs before the date section 28.6 of the Act comes into force.

content.provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Insurance Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 226, sections 192 and 192.1]
